But why do you want to meet the Chief?"

You smiled with as much confidence as you could muster after your humiliating affair. "Because I want to ask her to turn against the Monster Queen!" Your proclamation was met with a second round of laughter from your new wife, somehow more than before.

Vestra ruffled your hair like you were a dog. "Even if you somehow impress the Chief, to get the Amazon's on your side, you'd need to impress our Queen. But she's one of the Monster Queen's most trusted allies." You were more than a little disturbed to hear that. "Ah, but that's in the future. For now we need to get through the rest of our wedding ceremony. You can tell me what you want to do tonight."

You shivered, with dread! Not excitement, at least that's what you told yourself. "The rest of the ceremony?"

Vesta nodded. "Yes, first there's the banquet! Where they'll hold a tournament, the winner makes a request of me. After that we'll have to brand you-"

"Brand me!?"

Vestra looked even more amused than before. "The wife marks their husband with fast drying ink. It's usually just a hand print on their face or back. But maybe a foot print would be appropriate for you..." This disturbed and excited you at the same time. Vestra and you got dressed in finer clothes (yours being intended for a man) before stepping outside.

Vestra's redheaded friend ran over and started gushing. "Oh! That was so amazing! I've never seen a mating ritual like that before. I'm so doing that with my husband! W-when I get one, that is." She looked at Vestra's dark haired friend. "Diana couldn't believe it."

The dark haired Amazon only blushed.

Vestra draped an arm around you. "This is Kali..." The redhead waved. "And Diana..." The dark haired girl nodded. "My two closest friends."

You waved shyly. Not knowing what to say to two Amazon's who were convinced that you were a man.

Kali kept gushing like she hadn't been interrupted. "By Artemis! What did you call that? Foot worship? I have to try that with someone." The devious glimmer in her eyes made you nervous.

Diana frowned.

"What?" Kali asked before sighing. "Oh fine, banquet first." She regained her enthusiasm and pointed at Diana. "Where I'm going to beat you in the tournament!"

Diana shook her head.

"Yes I will, just watch!"

Vestra calmed Kali down and led you and them to the banquet area. There weren't any tables, just blankets they spread on the ground and sat on. The only exception being Vestra, who got to sit on a throne-like chair while you sat on a blanket next to her, you tried not to think about how close this put you to her feet. Near the blankets they were holding a tournament. Which at least meant they weren't focused on you...

Not until Kali opened her big mouth that is. "Vestra! Tell us about this foot worship." Her tail swayed behind her. "What's it like? Where'd you learn about it?" This got the attention of at least a dozen Amazon's.

You knew right away this wouldn't end well for you. Made evident when Vestra patted you on the head again. "A cat girl told me about it when I was looking for my husband. It's popular with other monsters and humans." You weren't so sure about that second part...

Kali looked disturbingly interested. "Show us!" The Amazon's all nodded, like children eager to learn something new.

"Gladly." Vestra stretched out her leg, flexing her toes. "Husband! I command you to sniff my toes!"

You hated being right. But, obediently, you crawled forward and leaned toward her sandal clad feet, taking a deep breath of the intoxicatingly strong scent. You felt yourself growing hot again as you took a second, longer breath. "I'm just acting, I don't like feet." You chanted to yourself as you sniffed your bride's smelly toes.

Kali watched you, transfixed, until the moment the tournament match ended. She hopped to her feet. "Alright! Let's go Diana, you and me!" She ran onto the tournament field. A confused Diana trailing after her. This drew some of the Amazon's attention away from you again. You almost felt disappointed, until you reminded yourself that this was totally just an act.

Kali and Diana faced each other on the field. The former declaring. "If I win, you have to worship my feet!" This instantly drew the rest of the crowd's attention. You realized, with both excitement and dread, that Vestra may have started a cultural movement for the Amazon's.
1242321.title: Stay with Vestra

choices: Ask if you can pay her in any other way(Foot worship?)
You decide to go on alone despite the risk
You decide to go with the mercenary kitsune to human village, trying to earn...
1243.content:
As you travel on a forest route, thinking about whether you made the right decision to look for that village, you are suddenly startled by a rustling sounds coming from the bushes! You look around nervously, and a bandit, human one suddenly jumps out of it!
You instinctively reach for your weapon, but the bandit just wags his finger at you.
"I wouldn't do that if I were you girlie." He says walking towards you"I've got 5 of my people in the bushes and on the trees behind you, just waitin' to shoot and stab you in the back the second you try anythin' funny."

"Just let me pass! I am on a quest to destroy Monster Empire!" You say, annoyed, trying not to show any fear
"Ain't we all? We humans gotta help each other with that! You "donate" to us everything you've got, and in exchange you can pass and continue your own quest, while we continue our own!" Said the man

Just as he finished saying that, you heard some yelling and commotion coming from behind you. Which made you turn around... there were 3 people, two women and one man there, but they were all lying unconscious or otherwise incapacitated on the road. A moment later, two more men seemingly fell down from trees above, also on the road.
"W-what the hell is goin' on?!" Said the bandit leader
"Nothing personal, I just got paid to capture you scum." You heard a voice and just as you turned back towards the leader, you've seen him struck with a blunt part of a giant axe. The surprising part however was that the enormous weapon was held by a kitsune!   Not only a monster girl, but also of the type more known from their magic prowess rather than melee combat skills.

Just as the unconscious leader fell onto the floor, the kitsune all of a sudden started approaching you herself. You were afraid for a moment she mistook you for one of the bandits, or just wanted to attack you to for being human, but the kitsune... who turned out to be surprisingly a bit taller than you, just took a closer look at you before sheathing her giant axe on her back.
"You don't seem like one of them... treat that rescue as a freebie then I guess. I already got paid from nearby village's chief for capturing this bunch anyway." She said
"Thanks a lot for the help!" You finally say, relieved that she didn't decide
"Help? I didn't plan to do that, so just forget about it. I don't want people around here to think I'm doing mercenary work for free." Said the kitsune, revealing herself to be a mercenary of some sort, as she started gathering all the bandits in one place, and tying them up with some rope

"Can you tell me where can I find Hayato village?" You decided to ask, just to make sure you were going right way to your destination
"Oh, those guys? You go that way and by the evening you should reach it. We have a bit of a bandit problem here recently, so hope you will be prepared for more guys like those, because I'm not gonna save you again without a payment." Said the kitsune, she seemed completely unbothered about any kind of monsters vs humans issues.
"Oh... why are there so many?" You asked
"Hell if I know, but the bussiness is good thanks to that, so I can't complain." Said the kitsune, despite her kinda cold exterior and money-focused mind, she didn't seem like a bad person to you... surprising given her race

"So... how much would protecting me until the Hayato village cost?" You ask reluctantly, knowing you are nowhere near ready to find multiple enemies in ambushes like that
"Oh? Well, it's pretty far, for entire day, and you would have to cover expenses of me getting a room at Hayato inn... 300 coins." Said the mercenary kitsune

You didn't have the necessary amount of money with you... but was travel alone really a good idea?
"Name's Kuroga by the way." Said the mercenary, still waiting for you answer
1243.title: Saved by a monster girl!

choices: It's opening! Something is coming out
You go in yourself
You're not the only one who found this
125.content: You considered your options and decided that both had equal opportunity for success and downfall. After prodding yourself for more time than you had any right too, you looked up to the sky to see if there was any intuition to be found. Night had long fallen over the land, shown by the bright stars that hung overhead. You sighed in relaxation as your mind slowly began to wander to years ago when you would look at the exact same night sky. Even when you were a priestess in training, a glance into the night sky always gave off some kind of relaxing aura. Your eyes scanned the stars until you noticed one star that seemed brighter than the others in view. Turning your gaze to the road in front of you, it seemed the bright star was pointing more towards the forest. Taking it as some kind of sign, you began walking to the entrance of the wood. Wishing for another moment of calm peace, you decided to take another look at the stars above. There you saw your deciding star, even brighter than it was before.....and in a completely different spot. You tilted your head, curious over to how the star could have moved so quickly....and could still be moving. After a few seconds of glancing, you began to realize the star wasn't getting brighter but closer! Within seconds, you hit the dirt as the sounds of burning became prevalent. An ear piercing screech echoed about you, giving you the idea the object was far closer than you would have been comfortable with. As soon as it began, it ended in a muffled slam and an earth shaking movement. With curiosity overtaking you, you rushed over to where you heard the object crash. Rushing through the brush and trees, you already began to notice the large chunks of dirt and rock strewn about. You pushed one last bush aside and your eyes fell upon the strangest.....thing...you had ever seen in your life. A construct made entirely of metal, still glowing and smoking from the fire that had disguised it as a star. Looking to the dirt path the object had carved, there was clearly more to this odd object than what was on the surface. Stepping forward, you could see a hatch in the top of the object.
125.title: A minor detour

choices: Follow the left to a large tentacled creature
Follow the center to a sanctum with a purple giant
Right door: Equipment beyond years...covered in a smelly slime
1252.content: You glance to the rod in your hand and then back to the hatch. You would clearly be able to open that thing with a little brute force, plus there were the positives to consider. It was after all unlikely anything inside would have survived that crash so there wouldn't be any harm in taking whatever this vessel had to offer. With your mind made up, you approached the batch and stuck your rod into the hatch cover. Within seconds, the panel opened up and you jumped down without hesitation. Your shoes made little noise as you landed on the cold metal floor, though again you weren't too concerned about stealth. Still...a few rotating red lights were still operational so maybe it was best to keep a careful eye around. Whirrs and gears and sounds the likes of which you had never heard before sounded all around as you crept down the sterile hallway. You sniffed the air around you, catching an odd whiff along the cold breeze. You couldn't tell what it was but somehow it seemed to be leading you through the ship. Soon, the smell led you to the end of the hallway and three different doors. Taking another sniff, the smell seemed to be coming from either the left or center doors. As for the right door, it had a different tint when compared to the other doors and sparked your curiosity.
1252.title: You go in yourself

info.brief_description: Will you defeet the Monster Girl Empire, or be crushed underfoot?
info.description:
(Uncreative title, I know, but it gets the job done. Sue me.)

This is an interactive story based on a storyline in The Ultimate Foot Fetish, which you can find here: http://www.writing.com/main/interact/item_id/1691262-The-Ultimate-Foot-Fetish/ma...

For centuries, humans and monster girls have been at war. Humanity has attempted to negotiate with the monster girls in hope of peace, and while some few monster girls are content to live alongside humans, monster girls who live under the banner of the Monster Queen are set in the notion that they are superior and humanity belongs under their feet, and will not stop their conquest until the human race is trampled underfoot, both figuratively and literally.

You are a young peasant hailing from a small village. You have aspirations of defeating the Monster Queen, as they have constantly plagued your home town. You’ve saved up enough money for a copper sword and a wooden shield. You know it’s not much, but it’s all you can afford for now. The only thing left is to say goodbye and embark on your quest…

RULES:
-No male feet. I have nothing against male feet personally, but the story is Monster GIRL feet. There’s a time and place for everything, ya know? I suppose if there were enough interest, I could make a "Monster Boy Feet" story... UPDATE: you can now find such a story here: http://www.writing.com/main/interact/item_id/2105407-Monster-Boy-Feet
-It’s up to you whether the main character has a foot fetish or not.
-Shrinking, hypnosis, transformation, and dirt/sweat are allowed and encouraged.
-Watersports and scat are NOT allowed
-Anything you want to write about that aren’t on those lists? Shoot me a PM first just to be sure.
-Not really a rule per se, but I’m very lenient on the definition of what qualifies as a “monster girl”. Anything from fantasy races (elves, goblins, etc.) to full-on furry is okay in my book.
-You have to use proper grammar and spelling. I’m not asking for a lexicon matching Shakespeare, but chapters like “ok adn then the cat grill makes u lick her feet what next” will be deleted.
-All non-choice chapters need to be at least a paragraph long.
-Speaking of which, try not to go overboard with choice chapters. I know I can’t really enforce this, but just pick something and then go with it. Don’t make a million choice chapters and expect someone else to write what you want to see.

That’s it. Have fun and enjoy!
